sourceMeaningMnemonic: The <radical>rice</radical> that's prepared at <radical>dawn</radical> by the <radical>village</radical> are <kanji>provisions</kanji> for the army. The army is scheduled to arrive right after dawn, so all of the village's provisions for them have to be ready by then.
meaningInfo: Picture everyone in the village getting all of their rice together as provisions for the army. Even the kids and old people are helping out.
readingMnemonic: Once all of the <kanji>provisions</kanji> are ready, the soldiers show up in their <reading>row</reading> (<ja>りょう</ja>) boats and load it all up. But they aren't done there. "Rice isn't enough, we need <reading>roe</reading> (<ja>ろう</ja>) so we will have the strength to row our row boats back." And so the village brings them all of their roe too.
readingInfo: Picture the soldiers gobbling down their provisions of rice and roe in their row boats as they row away.
